meanings.definition: Not firm or steady in movement or position.
meanings.sent1: The table became unsteadier as the legs wobbled.
meanings.sent2: The unsteadier ground made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: Her unsteadier dance moves brought laughter to the party.
meanings.sent4: The unsteadier bridge swayed in the wind, making crossing it a challenge.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadier boat rocked violently in the stormy sea.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of nervousness or lack of confidence.
meanings.sent1: His unsteadier voice revealed his anxiety during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: She felt unsteadier than usual before the important interview.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadier handshake gave away his nervousness.
meanings.sent4: Her unsteadier smile betrayed her lack of confidence.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadier tone of his speech hinted at his self-doubt.
